name: Ranger
description: A warrior who uses martial prowess and nature magic to combat threats on the edges of civilization.

1.name: Favored Enemy
1.description: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. Choose a type of favored enemy: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as favored enemies.

from.name: Aberrations
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track aberrations, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Beasts
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track beasts, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Celestials
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track celestials, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Constructs
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track constructs, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Dragons
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track dragons, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Elementals
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track elementals, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Fey
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track fey, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Fiends
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track fiends, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Giants
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track giants, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Monstrosities
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track monstrosities, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Oozes
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track oozes, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Plants
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track plants, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Undead
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track undead, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

from.name: Humanoids (Gnolls and Orcs)
from.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track gnolls and orcs, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

1.name: Natural Explorer
1.description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, or the Underdark.

from.name: Arctic
from.description: You are particularly familiar with arctic terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Coast
from.description: You are particularly familiar with coastal terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Desert
from.description: You are particularly familiar with desert terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Forest
from.description: You are particularly familiar with forest terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Grassland
from.description: You are particularly familiar with grassland terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Mountain
from.description: You are particularly familiar with mountain terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Swamp
from.description: You are particularly familiar with swamp terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

from.name: Underdark
from.description: You are particularly familiar with Underdark terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options:

from.name: Archery
from.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

from.name: Defense
from.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

from.name: Dueling
from.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

from.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
from.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

2.name: Spellcasting
2.description: You have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the ranger spell list.

3.name: Ranger Conclave
3.description: You choose to emulate the ideals and training of a ranger conclave. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

from.name: Hunter
from.description: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness.

from.name: Beast Master
from.description: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world.

from.name: Horizon Walker
from.description: Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes or that seek to ravage the mortal realm with otherworldly magic.

3.name: Primeval Awareness
3.description: You can use your action and expend a spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend, you can sense whether the following types of creatures are present within 1 mile of you (or within up to 6 miles if you are in your favored terrain): aberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Favored Enemy and Natural Explorer improvements
6.description: You choose one additional favored enemy, as well as one additional favored terrain.

7.name: Ranger Conclave feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

8.name: Land's Stride
8.description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

10.name: Hide in Plain Sight
10.description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You must have access to fresh mud, dirt, plants, soot, and other naturally occurring materials with which to create your camouflage. Once you are camouflaged in this way, you can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface that is at least as tall and wide as you are. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions.

11.name: Ranger Conclave feature
11.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

14.name: Favored Enemy improvement
14.description: You choose one additional favored enemy.

14.name: Vanish
14.description: You can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.

15.name: Ranger Conclave feature
15.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

18.name: Feral Senses
18.description: You gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it. You are also aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 feet of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't blinded or deafened.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

20.name: Foe Slayer
20.description: You become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your favored enemies. You can choose to use this feature before or after the roll, but before any effects of the roll are applied.

subclasses.name: Hunter
subclasses.description: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness.

3.name: Hunter's Prey
3.description: Choose one of the following features: Colossus Slayer, Giant Killer, or Horde Breaker.

7.name: Defensive Tactics
7.description: Choose one of the following features: Escape the Horde, Multiattack Defense, or Steel Will.

11.name: Multiattack
11.description: Choose one of the following features: Volley or Whirlwind Attack.

15.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
15.description: Choose one of the following features: Evasion, Stand Against the Tide, or Uncanny Dodge.

subclasses.name: Beast Master
subclasses.description: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world.

3.name: Ranger's Companion
3.description: You gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you.

7.name: Exceptional Training
7.description: Your beast companion can use its action to Dash, Disengage, or Help as a bonus action.

11.name: Bestial Fury
11.description: When you command your beast companion to take the Attack action, the beast can make two attacks.

15.name: Share Spells
15.description: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell.

subclasses.name: Gloom Stalker
subclasses.description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, using the shadows to their advantage.

3.name: Dread Ambusher
3.description: You gain extra speed and an additional attack on your first turn in combat, plus bonus damage.

3.name: Umbral Sight
3.description: You gain darkvision and are invisible to creatures that rely on darkvision to see you in darkness.

7.name: Iron Mind
7.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

11.name: Stalker's Flurry
11.description: When you miss with an attack, you can make an additional attack as part of the same action.

15.name: Shadowy Dodge
15.description: When a creature attacks you and doesn't have advantage, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage.

subclasses.name: Horizon Walker
subclasses.description: Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes.

3.name: Detect Portal
3.description: You can use an action to detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal.

3.name: Planar Warrior
3.description: As a bonus action, choose a creature. Your attacks against it deal extra force damage and become magical.

7.name: Ethereal Step
7.description: You can cast etherealness with this feature, without expending a spell slot.

11.name: Distant Strike
11.description: You can teleport before each attack and can attack an additional creature if each attack targets a different one.

15.name: Spectral Defense
15.description: When you take damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to all of that attack's damage.

subclasses.name: Monster Slayer
subclasses.description: You have dedicated yourself to hunting down dangerous creatures and supernatural threats.

3.name: Hunter's Sense
3.description: As an action, learn a creature's vulnerabilities, immunities, and resistances.

3.name: Slayer's Prey
3.description: As a bonus action, designate a creature as your prey for extra damage.

7.name: Supernatural Defense
7.description: Add 1d6 to saving throws against effects from your prey.

11.name: Magic-User's Nemesis
11.description: When your prey tries to teleport or cast a spell, you can use your reaction to make an attack and potentially stop them.

15.name: Slayer's Counter
15.description: If your prey forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make an attack against them.

subclasses.name: Fey Wanderer
subclasses.description: These rangers have strong ties to the Feywild and its creatures, gaining magical abilities from this connection.

3.name: Dreadful Strikes
3.description: Your strikes can be augmented with mind-scarring magic, dealing extra psychic damage.

3.name: Fey Wanderer Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class.

3.name: Otherworldly Glamour
3.description: You can add your Wisdom modifier to Charisma checks.

7.name: Beguiling Twist
7.description: You can redirect enchantment and frightening effects to other creatures.

11.name: Fey Reinforcements
11.description: You can summon fey creatures to aid you in battle.

15.name: Misty Wanderer
15.description: You can cast misty step without expending a spell slot, and can bring one willing creature with you.

subclasses.name: Swarmkeeper
subclasses.description: These rangers bond with a swarm of nature spirits that aid them in combat and exploration.

3.name: Gathered Swarm
3.description: You manifest a swarm of nature spirits that can assist your attacks and movement.

3.name: Swarmkeeper Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class.

7.name: Writhing Tide
7.description: You can move through the air using your swarm to carry you.

11.name: Mighty Swarm
11.description: Your swarm grows mightier, giving you additional options when you use Gathered Swarm.

15.name: Swarming Dispersal
15.description: You can turn into a swarm of tiny creatures when you would take damage.

subclasses.name: Drakewarden
subclasses.description: You have a special connection with drakes, magical creatures related to dragons.

3.name: Drake Companion
3.description: You can summon a drake companion that fights alongside you and grows stronger as you level up.

3.name: Draconic Gift
3.description: You can speak Draconic and gain a special benefit when you use the drake's breath weapon.

7.name: Drake Bond
7.description: Your drake can now fly and you can ride it as a mount.

11.name: Drake's Breath
11.description: You and your drake can use your actions together to unleash a powerful breath weapon.

15.name: Perfected Bond
15.description: Your drake grows to Large size and gains additional benefits.
